thread.title: Ivanka Trump’s jewelry company owes $5,000 in unpaid taxes
thread.title_full: Ivanka Trump’s jewelry company owes $5,000 in unpaid taxes - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Ivanka Trump’s jewelry company owes $5,000 in unpaid taxes
text:
Tax Day is around the corner and Ivanka Trump has been ordered to pay up.
The presidential daughter's extravagant jewelry company, Ivanka Trump Fine Jewelry, apparently owes $5,165.06 in unpaid taxes, according to a warrant issued by the New York state department on Jan. 27.
The company, which is formally registered as Madison Avenue Diamonds LLC, has an office listed in midtown Manhattan and hawks diamond studded bracelets, cuffs and bangles that cost upwards of $13,900 apiece.
An Ivanka Trump representative did not immediately return a request for comment from the Daily News, and the jewelry company's website was not operative on Tuesday evening.
Ethics office tells White House to ‘investigate’ Kellyanne Conway 
This is not the first time Ivanka Trump has gone through legal woes over her sprawling fashion line.
An Italian shoe company claimed in a suit filed in Manhattan federal court last year that the presidential daughter plagiarized one of its designs. The case remains open.
Ivanka Trump's sprawling fashion line has become the subject of a boycott by the name of #GrabYourWallet. (Drew Angerer/Getty Images) The year before that, the New York Supreme Court ordered Ivanka Trump Fine Jewelry to cough up a whopping $2,375,000 plus interest for refusing to pay its diamond supplier, according to a press release . Trump's company unsuccessfully argued that it didn't pay up because the supplier, KGK Jewelry, had supposedly been in violation of the contract by returning some computer-generated designs one day late.
Then, earlier this month, Ivanka Trump faced a series of retail headaches after Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus, Shoes.com and several other companies dropped her fashion line as part of the anti-President Trump #GrabYourWallet campaign.
Scott Baio boycotts Nordstrom after retailer ditches Ivanka Trump 
The President blasted the Nordstrom department store company for participating in the boycott.
"My daughter Ivanka has been treated so unfairly by @Nordstrom," the commander in chief fired over Twitter . "She is a great person — always pushing me to do the right thing! Terrible!"
